intro: Cryptantha circumscissa var. hispida, commonly known as the bristly cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy or bristly stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with short, stiff hairs. This variety is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments.
